content.body: In the HTML spec, if you have an element with `w-nodev` that contains another element with `w-nodev`, the inner `w-nodev` is redundant, right?
content.formatted_body: In the HTML spec, if you have an element with w-nodev that contains another element with w-nodev, the inner w-nodev is redundant, right?

content.body: It should be. You can verify by comparing the outputs...

Someone tried to reset my GitHub password this morning. The emails seem legit (at least the links all go to github.com), except they don’t include the advice to ignore them if it wasn’t you who requested it. Is that normal for GitHub?
